"Building Sustainable Cities" with Majora Carter
BSA Exploring Design Lecture Series at the Boston Public Library

The founder and director of Sustainable South Bronx (and recipient of a MacArthur "genius grant") describes efforts to mobilize grassroots environmental activism among New York City's poorest and most environmentally oppressed citizens and the challenges and opportunities inherent in building sustainable cities.

All lectures begin at 6:00 pm and all are free and open to the public. Additions and changes to the Exploring Design series are noted monthly in the BSA ChapterLetter and on the BSA website. For additional information, write/call the BSA at bsa@architects.org/617-951-1433 x221 or visit our website at architects.org/lectureseries.
